text:
Couple things noticed tonight working with JSPC and docs:

1. Description should mention that ant.jar is required for jasper when using 
Tomcat 4.x.  So, $TOMCAT_HOME/common/lib/ant.jar, jasper-compiler.jar, and 
jasper-runtime.jar are necessary.  If ant.jar is not explicitly in the JSPC 
classpath, I get this error:
jspc:
     [jspc] Compiling 18 source filesF:\dev\starteam\jspc_dest
  [jasperc] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/tools/ant/AntClassLoader
  [jasperc]     at org.apache.jasper.JspC.initClassLoader(JspC.java:420)
  [jasperc]     at org.apache.jasper.JspC.processFile(JspC.java:537)
  [jasperc]     at org.apache.jasper.JspC.execute(JspC.java:775)
  [jasperc]     at org.apache.jasper.JspC.main(JspC.java:797)
  [jasperc] Exception in thread "main"

2. Second example (showing nested <depend/> task) says "<depends" but should 
be "<depend"
creator: scottstirling@rcn.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Fixed 2.

But for (1), we are talking about an Ant task and if you invoke Ant using the
provided wrapper scripts, ant.jar is always on the CLASSPATH.  What am I missing?
